message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a high-quality item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm interested in the product, but $120 is a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider a price of $90?

I understand that $90 is a bit of a stretch for you, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle. I can sell it to you for $110. It's the lowest price I'm comfortable with, but I think you'll really like the product.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider a price of $100?
I'm getting close to my minimum price, but I'm still willing to negotiate. I can sell it to you for $105. This is as low as I can go, but I think it's a fair price for the quality of the product.
I understand that you're getting close to your minimum price, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. Would you be willing to consider a price of $98?
I'm not sure if I can go any lower than $105, but I'm willing to meet you halfway on the last offer. I can sell it to you for $102. This is as low as I'm willing to go.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to consider a price of $95?
I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal. I can sell it to you for $99. It's my last offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
I understand that $99 is your last offer, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again. Would you be willing to consider a price of $97?
I'm not going to go any lower than $99, but I'll tell you what - I'll meet you halfway on the last offer. I can sell it to you for $98. This is my final offer, and I'm not budging any further.
